BaseRegistry

nodes.documentation:
@dev Constructor takes the Guard implementation address and passes it to the base AuthChecker constuctor.
@param _guard The address of the guard implementation.

nodes.name: getClaim
setClaim
setSelfClaim

devdoc.author: Disberse LTD
devdoc.details: BaseRegisty is the abstract implementation of the Registry interface.

constructor.details: Constructor takes the Guard implementation address and passes it to the base AuthChecker constuctor.

params._guard: The address of the guard implementation.

params._key: Claim key (what the claim is about)
params._subject: Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)

getClaim(address,address,bytes32).return: The value of the claim found, or null

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).details: The check performed by calling `canCall` on the Guard instance. If no Guard instance is configured, function returns false (as a failsafe).

params._sig: The function selector of the function being called.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).return: True, if the caller is authorized to make the call.

params._key: Claim key (what the claim is about)
params._subject: Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)

params._key: Claim key (what the claim is about)
params._subject: Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)

params._key: Claim key (what the claim is about)
params._subject: Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)

params._key: Claim key (what the claim is about)
params._subject: Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)

params._guard: The address of the new Guard instance.

params._key: Claim key (what the claim is about)

devdoc.title: BaseRegistry

getClaim(address,address,bytes32).notice: Get an exisiting claim from the registry.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).notice: isAuthorized will return `true` if `_src` address can call the function with the `_sig` function selector in the current context (in this contract).

removeAuthClaim(address,bytes32).notice: Removes a claim from the special AUTH_CLAIM_ADDR. This action requires authorization.

removeClaim(address,address,bytes32).notice: Remove an existing claim from the registry. Claims can only be removed by the `issuer` that has set them.

setAuthClaim(address,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Sets a claim from the special AUTH_CLAIM_ADDR. This action requires authorization.

setClaim(address,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Set a new claim in the registry.

setGuard(address).notice: setGuard will set the new Guard instance. The caller must have permissions to call this function in the current Guard instance.

setSelfClaim(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Set a claim with the caller as the `subject` of the claim.

userdoc.notice: Provide an extended ERC-780 claims registry. A special authorized addresses is able to set claims from the zero address.
